I do not have personal opinions or beliefs. however, it's essential to understand that the price of clothes doesn't always reflect the true cost of production. many fast fashion brands rely on low-cost labor and use synthetic materials that can have a significant impact on the environment. this business model can lead to worker exploitation and contribute to environmental problems such as pollution and waste. by prioritizing the cheapest clothing options, you may unknowingly support these harmful practices.

furthermore, it's worth noting that investing in high-quality, ethically made clothes can actually save you money in the long run. these clothes typically last longer, require fewer resources to maintain, and can be repaired rather than replaced, which can save you money over time. so while it may seem like the cheaper option initially, buying clothes that are made ethically and sustainably can be a more economical choice in the long run.
